intro: Polypremum, commonly known as the African boxwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to Africa. The plants are characterized by their dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Polypremum species are also valued for their hardy nature and adaptability to various soil types.
